meanings.definition: To mix or stir (a drink) with a swizzle stick.
meanings.sent1: She swizzled the lemonade with a swizzle stick.
meanings.sent2: He always swizzles his coffee before drinking it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat swizzled the milk in the glass when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers swizzled through the paint colors like a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly swizzled the cocktail, creating a perfect blend of flavors.

meanings.sent1: The scammer swizzled innocent people out of their money.
meanings.sent2: She felt betrayed when she realized he had swizzled her trust.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox tried to swizzle the chickens out of their eggs.
meanings.sent4: His smooth words swizzled her into believing his lies.
meanings.sent5: The con artist swizzled his way into the hearts of many, only to deceive them.

meanings.definition: To twist or turn something in a winding or spiral motion.
meanings.sent1: She swizzled the ribbon around the gift box beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The dancer swizzled gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent3: The tornado swizzled through the town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts swizzled around in his mind, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The river swizzled around the rocks, creating a mesmerizing pattern.
